page.title: 13LIFE - CHANGES IN AYLESTONE
page.content: {** MRS.ROSS INTERVIEWED BY CHILDREN ** Mrs.Ross (80) has lived in Ayle- -stone for the last 50 years. She remembers when it was a village with open fields between it and Leicester. It was a small village with only 2 shops and they sold everything from food to bathplugs, but if you wanted clothes you had to go to Leicester. She remembers that 2 old ladies lived in a huge house and owned the fields around. They would not let anyone build there, because they liked to see cows,sheep and horses. When they died people started to build. Children played cricket and foot- -ball in the fields and collected train and tram numbers. They also used marbles and whips & tops. They had dances & concerts in the Church Hall, but had to go into Leicester for a cinema or swimming baths.
